William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:A traditional pub with a focus on sports.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:A traditional pub with a focus on sports.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The King's Head to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The King's Head to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he sat in the back of the crowded King's Head, watching his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, laugh and argue about the latest football match. He longed to join them, to share in their boisterous camaraderie, but a knot of anxiety tightened in his chest. He felt like an outsider looking in, his own thoughts and feelings too precious, too vulnerable to share.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, snuck into The King's Head after closing time. They were caught by the gruff owner, Mr. Higgins, who threatened to call the police. Jacob, fueled by a potent mix of adrenaline and defiance, stood up to Mr. Higgins, his voice booming through the empty pub, challenging the old man to a fight.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he watched in fury as his beloved football team, the local lads, were robbed of victory by a blatant refereeing error. The injustice ignited a firestorm within him, and he stormed onto the pitch, screaming obscenities at the referee. He was promptly ejected, banned from the next three games, and nearly arrested for disorderly conduct. His friends, though embarrassed, couldn't help but admire his passionate defense of what he believed was right.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the football game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, snuck into The King's Head after closing time. They were caught by the gruff owner, Mr. Higgins, who threatened to call the police. Jacob, fueled by a potent mix of adrenaline and defiance, stood up to Mr. Higgins, his voice booming through the empty pub, challenging the old man to a fight.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he watched in fury as his beloved football team, the local lads, were robbed of victory by a blatant refereeing error. The injustice ignited a firestorm within him, and he stormed onto the pitch, screaming obscenities at the referee. He was promptly ejected, banned from the next three games, and nearly arrested for disorderly conduct. His friends, though embarrassed, couldn't help but admire his passionate defense of what he believed was right.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:A traditional pub with a focus on sports.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the football game with his friends.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and is looking forward to watching the Andorra-Portugal game later at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the football game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, snuck into The King's Head after closing time.         • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components

        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends in Victoria Park and at a pub watching football games. He seemed to enjoy the park outing more than the pub experience.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends in Victoria Park and at a pub watching football, preferring the park. He is currently in Victoria Park on May 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones spent time with friends in Victoria Park and at a pub watching football, preferring the park. He is currently in Victoria Park on May 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he sat in the back of the crowded King's Head, watching his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, laugh and argue about the latest football match. He longed to join them, to share in their boisterous camaraderie, but a knot of anxiety tightened in his chest. He felt like an outsider looking in, his own thoughts and feelings too precious, too vulnerable to share.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:A traditional pub with a focus on sports.

William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends in Victoria Park and at a pub watching football games. He seemed to enjoy the park outing more than the pub experience.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The King's Head to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The King's Head.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he sat in the back of the crowded King's Head, watching his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, laugh and argue about the latest football match. He longed to join them, to share in their boisterous camaraderie, but a knot of anxiety tightened in his chest. He felt like an outsider looking in, his own thoughts and feelings too precious, too vulnerable to share.

          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends in Victoria Park and at a pub watching football games. He seemed to enjoy the park outing more than the pub experience.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and excitement of the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart.           Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The King's Head, as it is his preferred pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The King's Head, as it is his preferred pub.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game since he enjoyed watching games there previously and it is a familiar and comfortable environment for him.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest to his friends that they head to The King's Head to watch the Andorra vs Portugal game.
          [17:00 - 17:30] Travel to The King's Head.
          [17:30 - 22:00] Watch the game, enjoy pub food and drinks, and continue enjoying the camaraderie of his friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.

          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Jack Taylor take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game since he enjoyed watching games there previously and it is a familiar and comfortable environment for him.

          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends were able to join him at The King's Head for the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later that night.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and passionate friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is having coffee with friends at a market and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later at The King's Head pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying coffee with friends but likely feeling a bit down about the previous night's experience watching the game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to put on a brave face and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also subtly try to steer the conversation towards other topics besides the football game.

        • 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is having coffee with friends at a market and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later at The King's Head pub.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and introspective retired individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly in pubs and other convivial settings.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the bustling atmosphere of the market.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: initiate a conversation with his friends, expressing his desire to watch the game together at a pub.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The White Hart; [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game with friends at The White Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is a reserved and introspective retired individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly in pubs and other convivial settings.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alexander White take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alexander White should initiate a conversation with his friends, expressing his desire to watch the game together at a pub.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a bustling market where her friends are discussing where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night. They are considering The King's Head or The White Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The White Hart, to watch the game.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The White Hart, her favorite pub, where she is likely to feel more comfortable and enjoy herself.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Suggest to her friends that they watch the game at The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Head to The White Hart with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 14:30] Order drinks and snacks at The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 15:00] Enjoy the game with her friends at The White Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a retired member of the working class who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football at her favorite pub, The White Hart.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          core characteristics: a passionate and adventurous individual who enjoys experiencing life to the fullest and thrives on social connection. She is also loyal to her friends and values their company, as evidenced by her desire to spend time with them and her preference for their shared favorite pub, The White Hart. She can be seen as a bit of a rebel, willing to challenge authority and explore unconventional experiences.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          core characteristics: a passionate and adventurous individual who enjoys experiencing life to the fullest and thrives on social connection. She is also loyal to her friends and values their company, as evidenced by her desire to spend time with them and her preference for their shared favorite pub, The White Hart. She can be seen as a bit of a rebel, willing to challenge authority and explore unconventional experiences.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying a picnic with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and the pleasant atmosphere.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The White Hart to watch the game.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Suggest to her friends that they watch the game at The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Head to The White Hart with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 14:30] Order drinks and snacks at The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 15:00] Enjoy the game with her friends at The White Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer

        • Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a passionate and adventurous individual who enjoys experiencing life to the fullest and thrives on social connection.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest watching the football game at The White Hart with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The White Hart, to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a passionate and adventurous individual who enjoys experiencing life to the fullest and thrives on social connection. She is also a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games at her favorite pub, The White Hart.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and a little let down.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously. Where else would any self-respecting person go for a football match? The rest are filled with tourists and posers.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously. Where else would any self-respecting person go for a football match? The rest are filled with tourists and posers.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously. Where else would any self-respecting person go for a football match? The rest are filled with tourists and posers.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and passionate friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park but is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, but he is feeling emotionally pained and lonely.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to put on a brave face and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also subtly try to steer the conversation towards other topics besides the football game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously. Where else would any self-respecting person go for a football match? The rest are filled with tourists and posers.

        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling emotional pain and loneliness while spending time with friends at Victoria Park.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The White Hart would be lovely for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's not too crowded.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The White Hart would be lovely for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's not too crowded.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously. Where else would any self-respecting person go for a football match? The rest are filled with tourists and posers.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The White Hart would be lovely for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's not too crowded.

          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends in a park.

          Answer: Alexander White should continue to enjoy the afternoon with his friends, savoring the pleasant company and sunshine.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a reserved and introspective retired individual who values close friendships and finds comfort in familiar surroundings. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly in pubs, and prefers familiar establishments like The White Hart. While he appreciates the company of his friends, he seems to be somewhat melancholic and easily experiences disappointment when things don't go according to plan.
          current daily occupation: a retired individual.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that his friends don't share his preference for The White Hart and seems to be experiencing a recurring pattern of unhappiness when it comes to watching games with his friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat melancholic retiree who values close friendships and familiar surroundings.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously. Where else would any self-respecting person go for a football match? The rest are filled with tourists and posers.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart would be lovely for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's not too crowded.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
