          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously. Where else would any self-respecting person go for a football match? The rest are filled with tourists and posers.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart would be lovely for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's not too crowded.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where he and his friends are enjoying the sunshine. Later that evening, the group is planning to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and excitement of the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends and enjoying the camaraderie and excitement of the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would enjoy the company of his friends and engage in conversation.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest that the group go to The King's Head to watch the game.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest to his friends that they head to The King's Head to watch the Andorra vs Portugal game.
          [17:00 - 17:30] Travel to The King's Head.
          [17:30 - 22:00] Watch the game, enjoy pub food and drinks, and continue enjoying the camaraderie of his friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The King's Head is the best place to watch the game. It's got the best atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The King's Head is the best place to watch the game. It's got the best atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
      Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head better have a decent selection of ales tonight. I'm not settling for anything less after last night's debacle.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time?"
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The White Hart? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously. Where else would any self-respecting person go for a football match? The rest are filled with tourists and posers.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart would be lovely for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's not too crowded.
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The King's Head is the best place to watch the game. It's got the best atmosphere.

        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The King's Head is the best place to watch the game. It's got the best atmosphere.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously. Where else would any self-respecting person go for a football match? The rest are filled with tourists and posers.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart would be lovely for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's not too crowded.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a cafe, park, or pub watching football. He has a preference for The King's Head pub but is open to other options.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can try to convince his friends to go to The King's Head, or he can go to whichever pub the majority decides on.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The King's Head.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The King's Head

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he sat in the back of the crowded King's Head, watching his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, laugh and argue about the latest football match. He longed to join them, to share in their boisterous camaraderie, but a knot of anxiety tightened in his chest. He felt like an outsider looking in, his own thoughts and feelings too precious, too vulnerable to share.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to The King's Head pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:A traditional pub with a focus on sports.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could get up and go to The King's Head.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The King's Head.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Stage index

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at The King's Head with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, snuck into The King's Head after closing time. They were caught by the gruff owner, Mr. Higgins, who threatened to call the police. Jacob, fueled by a potent mix of adrenaline and defiance, stood up to Mr. Higgins, his voice booming through the empty pub, challenging the old man to a fight.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he watched in fury as his beloved football team, the local lads, were robbed of victory by a blatant refereeing error. The injustice ignited a firestorm within him, and he stormed onto the pitch, screaming obscenities at the referee. He was promptly ejected, banned from the next three games, and nearly arrested for disorderly conduct. His friends, though embarrassed, couldn't help but admire his passionate defense of what he believed was right.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:A traditional pub with a focus on sports.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the football game with his friends.

          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a low level of pain.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing mild pain and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the football game with his friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:A traditional pub with a focus on sports.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at The King's Head with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the football game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, snuck into The King's Head after closing time. They were caught by the gruff owner, Mr. Higgins, who threatened to call the police. Jacob, fueled by a potent mix of adrenaline and defiance, stood up to Mr. Higgins, his voice booming through the empty pub, challenging the old man to a fight.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he watched in fury as his beloved football team, the local lads, were robbed of victory by a blatant refereeing error. The injustice ignited a firestorm within him, and he stormed onto the pitch, screaming obscenities at the referee. He was promptly ejected, banned from the next three games, and nearly arrested for disorderly conduct. His friends, though embarrassed, couldn't help but admire his passionate defense of what he believed was right.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:A traditional pub with a focus on sports.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds lovely, let's go there!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is showing the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the football game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

        • The King's Head
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing mild pain and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at The King's Head with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the football game with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The King's Head

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, snuck into The King's Head after closing time. They were caught by the gruff owner, Mr. Higgins, who threatened to call the police. Jacob, fueled by a potent mix of adrenaline and defiance, stood up to Mr. Higgins, his voice booming through the empty pub, challenging the old man to a fight.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he watched in fury as his beloved football team, the local lads, were robbed of victory by a blatant refereeing error. The injustice ignited a firestorm within him, and he stormed onto the pitch, screaming obscenities at the referee. He was promptly ejected, banned from the next three games, and nearly arrested for disorderly conduct. His friends, though embarrassed, couldn't help but admire his passionate defense of what he believed was right.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The King's Head

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go watch a football game at a pub with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he encountered a homeless man huddled in a doorway, shivering in the cold. Jack, despite having only a few pounds in his pocket, bought the man a hot meal and a warm blanket, feeling a deep pang of sadness for his plight. That night, Jack couldn't shake the image of the man's despair, vowing to always help those less fortunate.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, were celebrating at The King's Head after a particularly grueling week of exams. A heated pool game erupted, with playful insults and laughter filling the air. Jack, despite being a skilled player, intentionally missed a shot, allowing Jacob, who was having a particularly rough time, to win the game and bask in the camaraderie. The joy on Jacob's face warmed Jack's heart, reinforcing his belief in the power of small acts of kindness.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go watch a football game at a pub with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and excitement of the game.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, were celebrating at The King's Head after a particularly grueling week of exams. A heated pool game erupted, with playful insults and laughter filling the air. The joy on Jacob's face warmed Jack's heart, reinforcing his belief in the power of small acts of kindness.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The King's Head is showing the game, I hear.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go watch a football game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and excitement of the game.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: text his friends and suggest meeting at The King's Head to watch the game.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest to his friends that they head to The King's Head to watch the Andorra vs Portugal game.
          [17:00 - 17:30] Travel to The King's Head.
          [17:30 - 22:00] Watch the game, enjoy pub food and drinks, and continue enjoying the camaraderie of his friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)

          Relevant memories:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, were celebrating at The King's Head after a particularly grueling week of exams. A heated pool game erupted, with playful insults and laughter filling the air. Jack, despite being a skilled player, intentionally missed a shot, allowing Jacob, who was having a particularly rough time, to win the game and bask in the camaraderie. The joy on Jacob's face warmed Jack's heart, reinforcing his belief in the power of small acts of kindness.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck into a local political rally, captivated by the fiery speeches and passionate protesters. She found herself swept up in the crowd, chanting slogans and feeling a thrill course through her as she challenged authority for the first time. This experience ignited a hunger within her, a desire to be at the heart of the action, to witness and expose the truth.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she and her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, stumbled upon a hidden speakeasy tucked away in a forgotten alley. The dimly lit room, with its worn velvet booths and the scent of illicit liquor, felt like a secret world. Alice, emboldened by a potent cocktail expertly crafted by the bartender, dared to challenge the gruff owner, sparking a lively debate that lasted until dawn. This night solidified their bond, forging a connection that thrived on shared adventures and a thirst for the unconventional.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The White Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck into a local political rally, captivated by the fiery speeches and passionate protesters. She found herself swept up in the crowd, chanting slogans and feeling a thrill course through her as she challenged authority for the first time. This experience ignited a hunger within her, a desire to be at the heart of the action, to witness and expose the truth.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she and her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, stumbled upon a hidden speakeasy tucked away in a forgotten alley. The dimly lit room, with its worn velvet booths and the scent of illicit liquor, felt like a secret world. Alice, emboldened by a potent cocktail expertly crafted by the bartender, dared to challenge the gruff owner, sparking a lively debate that lasted until dawn. This night solidified their bond, forging a connection that thrived on shared adventures and a thirst for the unconventional.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are skilled mixologists and passionate about their craft.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a passionate and adventurous individual who enjoys experiencing life to the fullest and thrives on social connection.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The White Hart.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a passionate and adventurous individual who enjoys experiencing life to the fullest and thrives on social connection.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The White Hart.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest to her friends that they go to The White Hart to watch the game.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Suggest to her friends that they watch the game at The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Head to The White Hart with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 14:30] Order drinks and snacks at The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 15:00] Enjoy the game with her friends at The White Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched from the sidelines as his classmates celebrated their victory on the football field. A wave of emptiness washed over him; he couldn't muster even a flicker of excitement for their joy, only a dull ache of loneliness. He retreated to the library, finding solace in the company of fictional characters who seemed to understand his melancholy better than his peers.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and introspective retired individual who values close friendships and finds comfort in familiar surroundings.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the convivial atmosphere of the pub.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest that his friends meet at The White Hart, as it is his preferred pub and he believes it would be a good place for them to enjoy the game together.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The White Hart; [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game with friends at The White Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
      William Jones: 0.5
      Alice Lewis: 0.25
      Alexander White: 0.25
      Jack Taylor: 0.5
      Jacob Walker: 0.5
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': "The King's Head", 'Alice Lewis': 'The White Hart', 'Alexander White': 'The White Hart', 'Jack Taylor': "The King's Head", 'Jacob Walker': "The King's Head"}

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and introspective retired individual who values close friendships and familiar surroundings.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the convivial atmosphere of the pub.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: try to connect with his friends at the pub and encourage them to join him in a more intimate setting if possible, as he seems to prefer smaller gatherings.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The White Hart; [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game with friends at The White Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

          Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alexander White take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alexander White should try to connect with his friends at the pub and encourage them to join him in a more intimate setting if possible, as he seems to prefer smaller gatherings.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a retired individual.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed with recent progress in life.
          core characteristics: a reserved and introspective retired individual who values close friendships and finds comfort in familiar surroundings. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly in pubs, and prefers The White Hart over other establishments. Despite his preference for a familiar setting, he is open to trying new places if his friends suggest them. He enjoys watching games with his friends and values their companionship. While he may not always be outwardly enthusiastic, he appreciates the company of his close-knit group and finds solace in their shared experiences.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and introspective retired individual who values close friendships and familiar surroundings.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The White Hart.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: try to convince her friends to go to The White Hart, as she had a bad experience at The King's Head the previous night and prefers the atmosphere at The White Hart.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Suggest to her friends that they watch the game at The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Head to The White Hart with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 14:30] Order drinks and snacks at The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 15:00] Enjoy the game with her friends at The White Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [14 May 2015 14:30] Order drinks and snacks at The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 15:00] Enjoy the game with her friends at The White Hart.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) No

          Answer: (a)

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alice Lewis take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should try to convince her friends to go to The White Hart, as she had a bad experience at The King's Head the previous night and prefers the atmosphere at The White Hart.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and passionate friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, thirsty, and alone and is planning to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a predicament.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to put on a brave face and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The King's Head

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The King's Head

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have.           Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends and enjoying the camaraderie and excitement of the game.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: try to convince his friends to go to The King's Head, as it is his preferred pub and he would likely have a better time if more of his friends were there.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest to his friends that they head to The King's Head to watch the Andorra vs Portugal game.
          [17:00 - 17:30] Travel to The King's Head.
          [17:30 - 22:00] Watch the game, enjoy pub food and drinks, and continue enjoying the camaraderie of his friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, were celebrating at The King's Head after a particularly grueling week of exams. A heated pool game erupted, with playful insults and laughter filling the air. Jack, despite being a skilled player, intentionally missed a shot, allowing Jacob, who was having a particularly rough time, to win the game and bask in the camaraderie. The joy on Jacob's face warmed Jack's heart, reinforcing his belief in the power of small acts of kindness.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories and laughter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and excitement of the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a kind and compassionate person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Jack Taylor take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should try to convince his friends to go to The King's Head, as it is his preferred pub and he would likely have a better time if more of his friends were there.
